com.nitnelave.CreeperHeal.block

Class CreeperBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nitnelave.CreeperHeal.block.CreeperBlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Replaceable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CreeperButton, CreeperStone, SpoutBlock

    public class CreeperBlock
extends java.lang.Object
implements Replaceable
    Represents a block that can be replaced. Every special type of block derives from this class, and can only be constructed by using the newBlock method.
    Author:
    nitnelave

      • drop

        public boolean drop(boolean forced)
        Drop the corresponding items on the ground.
        Specified by:
        drop in interface Replaceable
        Parameters:
        forced - If false, the block will have a chance to drop, according to the configuration value of the drop chance. If true, the block drops every time.
        Returns:
        True if the block dropped.

      • replace

        public final boolean replace(boolean shouldDrop)
        Description copied from interface: Replaceable
        Replace the block in the world. In case of a dependent item whose support is absent, the boolean shouldDrop determines whether the replacement is postponed or if the item should be dropped.
        Specified by:
        replace in interface Replaceable
        Parameters:
        shouldDrop - If true, the item will drop, otherwise its replacement will be postponed.
        Returns:
        False if the replacement was postponed.

      • delayReplacement

        public void delayReplacement(CHBlockHealEvent.CHBlockHealReason reason)
        Description copied from interface: Replaceable
        Delay the block's replacement until it is possible for it to spawn, or drop it after a reasonable amount of tries.
        Specified by:
        delayReplacement in interface Replaceable
        Parameters:
        reason - How was this block replaced

      • getDependentNeighbors

        public java.util.List<NeighborBlock> getDependentNeighbors()
        Get the list of blocks that are possibly dependent on this block. To check if they really are, simply check that neighborBlock.isNeighbor() is true.
        Returns:
        The list of potentially dependent blocks.
